title: Language Competency Enhancement Course Applying Dialectical Constructivism: Integrating Critical Thinking and Argumentative Expression

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language skills (reading, writing, speaking, listening) and general topic comprehension, experience using fundamental grammatical structures and task-appropriate vocabulary, and elementary grasp of logical frameworks for critical thinking
context.additional_context: Targeting office/administrative professionals, this program emphasizes improving job-related language skills, particularly in report writing, presentations, and negotiation scenarios. It prioritizes persuasive text structuring and context-appropriate vocabulary selection as demanded in real-world tasks.

learning_goals: Learners critically evaluate the logical structure and vocabulary usage of texts by applying at least three dialectical analysis frameworks (e.g., thesis-antithesis-synthesis model) to language-related topics.

Through a discussion platform, learners generate and share at least one logical counterargument (e.g., counterexamples, assumption critiques, alternative proposals) to peersâ€™ claims, enhancing argumentative writing and oral expression skills.

By comparing three formal documents and three negotiation dialogues, learners derive at least two practical communication strategies (e.g., persuasive phrasing, context-specific vocabulary) aligned with an analytical framework (context, purpose, audience proficiency) and write 150-character application plans per case.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
